newsitem.title: GERMANY: EMS/Mark crosses at top of ranges in late Europe.
newsitem.headline: EMS/Mark crosses at top of ranges in late Europe.

text.p: 1355 GMT - Mark steady on crosses in afternoon Europe, near upper end of day's range as market awaits developments over EMU timetable.

* Trade nervous over agreement of EMU budget stability pact. France called for delay to agreement of pact on Monday, opening up debate on prospect of EMU delay and making finalisation of pact less likely at next week's Amsterdam EU summit.
* Belgium PM Dehaene sees EMU on time in 1999 and German foreign minister Kinkel says French delay no threat to EMU.
* But Friedhelm Ost, key member of Chancellor Kohl's CDU party, says EMU should be delayed if Germany doesn't meet criteria. Economics minister Rexrodt says Bonn will meet target without tax hikes.
* Focus now on EU commissioner Santer meeting with French president Chirac and PM Jospin on Thursday, Franco-German summit Friday.
* Mark/French franc at 3.3838/42 vs 3.3790/95 late Monday. Mark/lira trading at 990.40/70 from 987.67/87.
* German coalition urges government to approve EU jobs chapter in so-called Maastricht II, signalling shift in German policy on EMU.
* Spain's Montoro says EMU delay politically impossible. Budget sec Folgado says Spain budget deficit to May just over 1 pct of GDP. Mark/peseta at 84.73/76 vs 84.67/68.
